summary: Andrew ORDONO Camps, referred to as AMCARBON-1 and AMCARDON-1 in the documents, was a media contact at The Miami Herald. He had a relationship with JMWAVE, a CIA station, from December 1962 to March 1964. He provided operational support, intelligence, and served as a propaganda outlet for JMWAVE. He also helped ensure the security of JMWAVE operations in South Florida. A request was made to assign him a 201 number.
significance: Andrew ORDONO Camps' significance in the JFK context lies in his connection to JMWAVE, a CIA station, and his role in providing operational support, intelligence, and propaganda services. This highlights the CIA's use of media contacts for operational purposes during this period.
